natural solution: We can write \begin{align} 1061520150601 &= 1 \cdot 100^6 + 6 \cdot 100^5 + 15 \cdot 100^4\\ &\quad + 20 \cdot 100^3+ 15 \cdot 100^2 + 6 \cdot 100 + 1. \\ \end{align}Notice that the cofficients on powers of 100 are all binomial.
\end{align}By the binomial theorem, this is equal to $(100 + 1)^6$, so its sixth root is $\boxed{101}$.
